resources.string: A man is looking at a photograph of someone. His friend asks who it is. The man replies, “Brothers and sisters, I have none. But that man’s father is my father’s son.” Who was in the photograph?
Mike is a butcher. He is 5’10” tall. What does he weigh?
A farmer has 17 sheep and all but nine die. How many are left?
Which is heavier? A pound of feathers or a pound of rocks?
What is full of holes but can still hold water?
When young, I am sweet in the sun.When middle-aged, I make you gay.When old, I am valued more than ever.
Give me food, and I will live; give me water, and I will die. What am I?
When you have me, you immediately feel like sharing me. But, if you do share me, you do not have me.
What can you hold without ever touching or using your hands?

I have no voice, yet I speak to you. \nI tell of all things in the world that people do.I have leaves, but I am not a tree.I have pages, but I am not a bride.I have a spine, but I am not a man.I have hinges, but I am not a door.I have told you all. \nI cannot tell you more.What am I?
